thread.title: Matchup: San Jose State at UNLV
thread.title_full: Matchup: San Jose State at UNLV

author:
Jon Wilner

jwilner@mercurynews.com
title: Matchup: San Jose State at UNLV
text:
SAN JOSE STATE AT UNLV RECORDS: San Jose State 2-3/1-1. UNLV 2-3/1-0. 
KICKOFF: 6 p.m. at Sam Boyd Stadium 
TV/RADIO: Mountain West Network and Campus Insiders/1590-AM 
SERIES HISTORY: San Jose State leads 13-5-1 and has won five in a row, including a 33-10 victory last season. 
STORYLINES: A victory would make the path to the postseason easier for SJSU, which needs four wins in its final seven games to become bowl-eligible. The Spartans would also improve their position in the wide open race for the West division title ... The Spartans have 473 rushing yards in the past two games ... UNLV quarterback Blake Decker is doubtful because of a shoulder injury. His replacement, Kurt Palandach, is a sophomore with 38 career passes ... SJSU is favored by 2.5 points. 
INJURY UPDATE: San Jose State — RB Thomas Tucker (ankle) is out. LB Christian Tago (neck stinger) and QB Kenny Potter (ankle) are probable. UNLV — QB Blake Decker (shoulder) is doubtful. 
MATCHUP TO WATCH: SJSU's front seven against UNLV's offensive line ... The Rebels are third in the league in rushing (224.2 yards per game) while the Spartans are last in defending the run (235.8) ... Size won't be the issue: The Rebels don't have any linemen over 295 pounds ... Instead, the challenges for SJSU are making the proper reads, staying disciplined, filling gaps and corralling UNLV's ballcarriers on first contact. Advertisement 
STATS THAT MATTER: SJSU TB Tyler Ervin is second in the nation in rushing (160.2) and all-purpose (227.6) yards per game ... The Spartans are converting 46 percent of their third downs, tops in the Mountain West ... UNLV has a turnover margin of plus-1 per game. SJSU's margin is minus-1 per game ... The Spartans have lost seven consecutive road games dating to the middle of last season.
